58   | /**
59   |  **  Error weights
60   |  **/
61   | 
62   | typedef enum _err_weights	{
63   |     WGHT_NONE=0,			/** Dummy value: No error	     **/
64   |     WGHT_VERBOSE,			/** Verbose messages		     **/
65   |     WGHT_INFO=3,			/** Informal message	 	     **/
66   |     WGHT_DEBUG=5,			/** Debugger output		     **/
67   |     WGHT_WARN=10,			/** Warning: Prog. flow not affected **/
68   |     WGHT_PROB=20,			/** Problem: Prog. flow cond. aff.   **/
69   |     WGHT_ERROR=25,			/** Error and Fatal: Prog. flow aff. **/
70   |     WGHT_FATAL=27,			/**   Return to the caller	     **/
71   |     WGHT_PANIC=29			/** Panic: Exit program immediatelly **/
72   | } ErrWeights;
73   | 
74   | /**
75   |  **  Log facilities
76   |  **/
77   | 
78   | typedef	struct	_err_facility	{
79   |     ErrWeights	 Weight;		/** Error weight 		     **/
80   |     char	*facility;		/** Log facility		     **/
81   |     char	*def_facility;		/** Default facility (facility undef)**/
82   | } ErrFacilities;
83   | 
84   | typedef struct	_facil_names	{
85   |     char 	*name;			/** Name of a facility		     **/
86   |     int		 token;			/** Assigned token		     **/
87   | } FacilityNames;
88   | 
89   | /**
90   |  **  Error measurement table
91   |  **/
92   | 
93   | typedef	struct	{
94   |     ErrWeights	 error_weight;		/** The weight itsself		     **/
95   |     char	*message;		/** Message to be printed	     **/
96   |     ErrCode	 ret_nov,		/** Return code			     **/
97   | 		 ret_adv,
98   | 		 ret_exp;
99   | } ErrMeasr;
100  | 
101  | /**
102  |  **  Error code translation table
103  |  **/
104  | 
105  | typedef struct  { 
106  |     ErrType	  error_type;		/** The error type as specified by   **/
107  | 					/** the caller			     **/
108  |     ErrWeights    error_weight;		/** The weight of this error         **/
109  |     char	 *messages;		/** List of messages to be printed   **/
110  | } ErrTransTab;

237  | /**
238  |  **  Error code translation table
239  |  **  Take care that this list is sorted in ascending order concerning the error
240  |  **  types.
241  |  **  Error weights (WGHT_*)
242  |  **	WARN	- warnings
243  |  **	PROB	- problems (normally the modulecmd may be completed)
244  |  **	ERROR	- errors (which normally leads to an unsuccessful end)
245  |  **	FATAL	- fatal system errors
246  |  **	PANIC	- very fatal system errors (internal program inconsistencies)
247  |  **/
248  |

369  | 				int		  lineno,

403  | 
404  | /*++++
405  |  ** ** Function-Header ***************************************************** **
406  |  ** 									     **
407  |  **   Function:		Module_Verbosity				     **
408  |  ** 									     **
409  |  **   Description:	Display a verbose message			     **
410  |  ** 									     **
411  |  **   First Edition:	1995/12/27					     **
412  |  ** 									     **
413  |  **   Parameters:	int	result	Result code of the module command    **
414  |  **			int	argc	Number of arguments to the module    **
415  |  **					command				     **
416  |  **			char	**argv	Argument array			     **
417  |  **			char	*buffer	Print buffer			     **
418  |  ** 									     **
419  |  **   Result:		-						     **
420  |  ** 									     **
421  |  **   Attached Globals:	g_current_module	The module which is handled  **
422  |  **						by the current command	     **
423  |  ** 									     **
424  |  ** ************************************************************************ **
425  |  ++++*/
426  | 
427  | void Module_Verbosity(	int	argc,
428  | 		   	char	**argv)
429  | {
430  |     if( sw_verbose && argc && *argv)
431  | 	if( !FlushError( NO_ERR_VERBOSE, g_current_module,linenum,WGHT_VERBOSE,
432  | 	    Measurements[ MEAS_VERB_NDX].message, *argv, argc, argv)) {
433  | 	    ErrorLogger( ERR_INTERRL, LOC, NULL);
434  | 	}
435  | 
436  | } /** End of 'Module_Verbosity' **/
437  | 
438  | 
439  | /*++++
440  |  ** ** Function-Header ***************************************************** **
441  |  ** 									     **
442  |  **   Function:		Enable_Error, Disable_Error, Restore_Error	     **
443  |  ** 									     **
444  |  **   Description:	Enables, disables, or restores error logging	     **
445  |  ** 			Sometimes an error isn't really an error	     **
446  |  ** 									     **
447  |  **   First Edition:	1999/11/11					     **
448  |  ** 									     **
449  |  **   Parameters:	none						     **
450  |  ** 									     **
451  |  **   Result:		none						     **
452  |  ** 									     **
453  |  ** ************************************************************************ **
454  |  ++++*/
455  | 
456  | static void save_error_state(int reset) {
457  | 	static int in_effect = 0;
458  | 	static int saved_state = 0;
459  | 
460  | 	if (reset && in_effect ) {
461  | 		quiet_on_error = saved_state;
462  | 		in_effect = 0;
463  | 	} else if (!reset && !in_effect ) {
464  | 		saved_state = quiet_on_error;
465  | 		in_effect = 1;
466  | 	}
467  | }
468  | 
469  | 
470  | void Enable_Error(void) {
471  | 	save_error_state(0);
472  | 	quiet_on_error = 0;
473  | }
474  | 
475  | void Disable_Error(void) {
476  | 	save_error_state(0);
477  | 	quiet_on_error = 1;
478  | }
479  | 
480  | void Restore_Error(void) {
481  | 	quiet_on_error = 0;	/* the default is to output errors */
482  | 	save_error_state(1);
483  | }
484  | 
485  | /*++++
486  |  ** ** Function-Header ***************************************************** **
487  |  ** 									     **
488  |  **   Function:		Module_Error					     **
489  |  ** 									     **
490  |  **   Description:	Error handling for the modules package		     **
491  |  ** 									     **
492  |  **   First Edition:	1995/08/06					     **
493  |  ** 									     **
494  |  **   Parameters:	ErrType		 error_type	Type of the error    **
495  |  **			char		*module		Affected module	     **
496  |  **			int		 lineo		Line number	     **
497  |  **			...				Argument list	     **
498  |  ** 									     **
499  |  **   Result:		ErrCode		OK		No error	     **
500  |  **					PROBLEM		Problem. Program may **
501  |  **							continue running     **
502  |  **					ERROR		Caller should try to **
503  |  **							exit gracefully      **
504  |  ** 									     **
505  |  **   Attached Globals:							     **
506  |  ** 									     **
507  |  ** ************************************************************************ **
508  |  ++++*/
509  | 
510  | int Module_Error(	ErrType		  error_type,
511  | 		   	char		 *module,
512  | 		   	int		  lineno,
513  | 		   	... )
514  | {
515  |     int		  listsize = ARGLIST_SIZE,	/** Initial size of the argu-**/
516  | 						/** ment list		     **/
517  | 		  argc = 0;			/** Actual number of args    **/
518  |     char	**argv,				/** Argument array	     **/
519  | 		 *arg;				/** A single argument	     **/
520  |     va_list	  parptr;			/** Varargs scan pointer     **/
521  |     ErrTransTab	 *TransPtr;			/** Error transtab entry     **/
522  |     ErrMeasr	 *MeasPtr;			/** Measurement pointer      **/
523  |     ErrCode	  ret_code;
524  |     int		  NoArgs = (error_type == ERR_ALLOC);
525  | 
526  |     if( quiet_on_error ) return OK;		/* do nothing - just OK */
527  | 
528  |     /**
529  |      **  Argument check
530  |      **/
531  |     if( NO_ERR_VERBOSE == error_type && !sw_verbose)
532  | 	return( OK);
533  | 
534  |     if( !module)
535  | 	module = _(em_unknown);
536  | 
537  |     /**
538  |      **  Build the argument array at first
539  |      **/
540  | 
541  |     if( NULL == (argv = (char **) module_malloc(listsize * sizeof( char *)))) {
542  | 	module = module_name;
543  | 	error_type = ERR_ALLOC;
544  | 	NoArgs = 1;
545  |     }
546  | 
547  |     va_start( parptr, lineno);
548  |     while( !NoArgs && (NULL != (arg = va_arg( parptr, char *)))) {
549  | 
550  | 	/**
551  | 	 **  Conditionally realloc
552  | 	 **/
553  | 	while( argc >= listsize) {
554  | 	    listsize += ARGLIST_SIZE;
555  | 	    if( NULL == (argv = (char **) realloc( argv,
556  | 		listsize * sizeof(char *)))) {
557  | 		module = module_name;
558  | 		error_type = ERR_ALLOC;
559  | 		NoArgs = 1;
560  | 		break;
561  | 	    }
562  | 	}
563  | 
564  | 	argv[ argc++] = arg;
565  | 
566  |     } /** while **/
567  |     
568  |     if( NO_ERR_VERBOSE == error_type && !argc)
569  | 	return( OK);
570  | 
571  |     /**
572  |      **  Locate the error translation table entry according to the 
573  |      **  passed error type
574  |      **/
575  |     if( NULL == (TransPtr = ErrorLookup( error_type))) {
576  | 	if( argv)
577  | 	    null_free((void *) &argv);
578  | 	return( ErrorLogger( ERR_INVAL, LOC, (sprintf( buffer, "%d",
579  | 	    error_type), buffer), NULL));
580  |     }
581  |     
582  |     /**
583  |      **  Now locate the assigned error weight ...
584  |      **/
585  | 
586  |     if( NULL == (MeasPtr = MeasLookup( TransPtr->error_weight))) {
587  | 	if( argv)
588  | 	    null_free((void *) &argv);
589  | 	argc = 0;
590  | 	return( ErrorLogger( ERR_INVWGHT, LOC, (sprintf( buffer, "%d",
591  | 	    TransPtr->error_weight), buffer), NULL));
592  |     }
593  | 
594  |     /**
595  |      **  Use the return code as defined for the current user level
596  |      **/
597  |     switch( sw_userlvl) {
598  | 	case UL_NOVICE:
599  | 	    ret_code = MeasPtr->ret_nov;
600  | 	    break;
601  | 	case UL_ADVANCED:
602  | 	    ret_code = MeasPtr->ret_adv;
603  | 	    break;
604  | 	case UL_EXPERT:
605  | 	    ret_code = MeasPtr->ret_exp;
606  | 	    break;
607  |     }
608  | 
609  |     /**
610  |      **  Print the error message
611  |      **/
612  |     if( TransPtr->error_weight <= WGHT_DEBUG || ret_code != OK)
613  | 	if( !FlushError( error_type, module, lineno, TransPtr->error_weight,
614  | 	    MeasPtr->message, TransPtr->messages, argc, argv)) {
615  | 	    if( argv)
616  | 		null_free((void *) &argv);
617  | 	    argc = 0;
618  | 	    return( ErrorLogger( ERR_INTERRL, LOC, NULL));
619  | 	}
620  | 
621  |     /**
622  |      **  Return to the caller ... conditionally ...
623  |      **/
624  |     if( WARN == ret_code)
625  | 	ret_code = OK;
626  | 
627  |     if( argv)
628  | 	null_free((void *) &argv);
629  |     argc = 0;
630  | 
631  |     if( ret_code > ERROR)
632  | 	exit( ret_code);
633  | 
634  |     return( ret_code);
635  | } /** End of 'Module_Error' **/
636  | 
637  | /*++++
638  |  ** ** Function-Header ***************************************************** **
639  |  ** 									     **
640  |  **   Function:		ErrorLookup					     **
641  |  ** 									     **
642  |  **   Description:	Look up the passed error type in the translation tab.**
643  |  ** 									     **
644  |  **   First Edition:	1995/08/06					     **
645  |  ** 									     **
646  |  **   Parameters:	ErrType		 error_type	Type of the error    **
647  |  ** 									     **
648  |  **   Result:		ErrTransTab*	NULL	Not found		     **
649  |  **					else	Pointer to the acc. entry    **
650  |  ** 									     **
651  |  **   Attached Globals:							     **
652  |  ** 									     **
653  |  ** ************************************************************************ **
654  |  ++++*/
655  | 
656  | static	ErrTransTab	*ErrorLookup(	ErrType error_type )
657  | {
658  |     ErrTransTab	*low, *mid, *high, *save;	/** Search pointers	     **/
659  | 
660  |     /**
661  |      **  Init serach pointers
662  |      **/
663  | 
664  |     low = TransTab;
665  |     high = TransTab + (sizeof( TransTab) / sizeof( TransTab[0]) -1);
666  |     mid = (ErrTransTab *) NULL;
667  | 
668  |     /**
669  |      **  Search loop
670  |      **/
671  | 
672  |     while( low < high) {
673  | 
674  | 	save = mid;
675  | 	mid = low + ((high - low) / 2);
676  | 	if( save == mid)
677  | 	    low = mid = high;			/** Just for safety ...	     **/
678  | 
679  | 	if( mid->error_type < error_type ) {
680  | 	    low = mid;
681  | 	} else if( mid->error_type > error_type ) {
682  | 	    high = mid;
683  | 	} else
684  | 	    return( mid);		/** Yep! Got it!		     **/
685  | 
686  |     } /** while **/
687  | 
688  |     /**
689  |      **  Maybe the loop has been finished before the comparison took place
690  |      **  (low == high) and hit!
691  |      **/
692  | 
693  |     if( mid->error_type == error_type )
694  | 	return( mid);               	/** Yep! Got it!                     **/
695  | 
696  |     /**
697  |      **  If this point is reached, nothing has been found ...
698  |      **/
699  | 
700  |     return( NULL);
701  | 
702  | } /** End of 'ErrorLookup' **/
703  | 
704  | /*++++
705  |  ** ** Function-Header ***************************************************** **
706  |  ** 									     **
707  |  **   Function:		MeasLookup					     **
708  |  ** 									     **
709  |  **   Description:	Look up the passed error weight in the measurement   **
710  |  **			table						     **
711  |  ** 									     **
712  |  **   First Edition:	1995/08/06					     **
713  |  ** 									     **
714  |  **   Parameters:	ErrWeights	weigth	Weight of the error	     **
715  |  ** 									     **
716  |  **   Result:		ErrMeasr*	NULL	Not found		     **
717  |  **					else	Pointer to the acc. entry    **
718  |  ** 									     **
719  |  **   Attached Globals:							     **
720  |  ** 									     **
721  |  ** ************************************************************************ **
722  |  ++++*/
723  | 
724  | static	ErrMeasr	*MeasLookup(	ErrWeights weigth )
725  | {
726  |     ErrMeasr	*low, *mid, *high, *save;	/** Search pointers	     **/
727  | 
728  |     /**
729  |      **  Init serach pointers
730  |      **/
731  | 
732  |     low = Measurements;
733  |     high = Measurements + (sizeof( Measurements) / sizeof( Measurements[0]) -1);
734  |     save = (ErrMeasr *) NULL;
735  |     mid = (ErrMeasr *) NULL;
736  | 
737  |     /**
738  |      **  Search loop
739  |      **/
740  | 
741  |     while( low < high) {
742  | 
743  | 	save = mid;
744  | 	mid = low + ((high - low) / 2);
745  | 	if( save == mid)
746  | 	    low = mid = high;			/** Just to be sure ...      **/
747  | 
748  | 	if( mid->error_weight < weigth ) {
749  | 	    low = mid;
750  | 	} else if( mid->error_weight > weigth ) {
751  | 	    high = mid;
752  | 	} else
753  | 	    return( mid);		/** Yep! Got it!		     **/
754  | 
755  |     } /** while **/
756  | 
757  |     /**
758  |      **  Maybe the loop has been finished before the comparison took place
759  |      **  (low == high) and hit!
760  |      **/
761  | 
762  |     if( mid->error_weight == weigth )
763  | 	return( mid);               	/** Yep! Got it!                     **/
764  | 
765  |     /**
766  |      **  If this point is reached, nothing has been found ...
767  |      **/
768  | 
769  |     return( NULL);
770  | 
771  | } /** End of 'MeasLookup' **/
772  | 
773  | /*++++
774  |  ** ** Function-Header ***************************************************** **
775  |  ** 									     **
776  |  **   Function:		FlushError					     **
777  |  ** 									     **
778  |  **   Description:	Print the error message. Decide which facility to    **
779  |  **			use and schedule the according logger routine	     **
780  |  ** 									     **
781  |  **   First Edition:	1995/12/21					     **
782  |  ** 									     **
783  |  **   Parameters:	ErrType		  Type		Error type as passed **
784  |  **			char		 *module	Module name	     **
785  |  **			int		  lineno	Line number	     **
786  |  **		  	ErrWeights	  Weight	Error Weight	     **
787  |  **			char		 *WeightMsg	Printable Weight     **
788  |  **			char		 *ErrMsgs	Error message	     **
789  |  **			int		  argc		Number of arguments  **
790  |  **			char		**argv		Argument array	     **
791  |  ** 									     **
792  |  **   Result:		int	1		Everything OK		     **
793  |  **				0		Error occured while printing **
794  |  ** 									     **
795  |  ** ************************************************************************ **
796  |  ++++*/
797  | 
798  | static	int	FlushError(	ErrType		  Type,
799  | 				char		 *module,
800  | 				int		  lineno,
801  | 				ErrWeights	  Weight,
802  | 				char		 *WeightMsg,
803  | 				char		 *ErrMsgs,
804  | 				int		  argc,
805  | 				char		**argv)
806  | {
807  |     char	*facilities;
808  |     char 	*fac;
809  |     FILE	*facfp;
810  |     char	*errmsg_buffer, *fac_buffer;
811  | 
812  |     /**
813  |      **  get the error facilities at first. If there isn't any, we may
814  |      **  return on success immediatelly.
815  |      **/
816  |     if((char *) NULL == (facilities = GetFacility( Weight)))
817  | 	goto success0;
818  | 
819  |     /**
820  |      **  copy the facilities string so we can do some changes in it
821  |      **/
822  |     if((char *) NULL == (fac_buffer = stringer(NULL, 0, facilities, NULL))) {
823  | 	ErrorLogger( ERR_ALLOC, LOC, NULL);
824  | 	goto unwind0;
825  |     }
826  | 
827  |     /**
828  |      **  Print the error message into the buffer
829  |      **/
830  |     if((char *) NULL == (errmsg_buffer = stringer(NULL, ERR_BUFSIZE, NULL))) {
831  | 	ErrorLogger( ERR_ALLOC, LOC, NULL);
832  | 	goto unwind1;
833  |     }
834  | 
835  |     /**
836  |      **  In case of verbosity, the first argument is the ErrMsgs format string
837  |      **/
838  |     if( WGHT_VERBOSE == Weight) {
839  | 	ErrMsgs = *argv++;
840  | 	--argc;
841  |     }
842  | 
843  |     if( !PrintError( errmsg_buffer, Type, module, lineno, Weight,
844  | 	WeightMsg, ErrMsgs, argc, argv))
845  | 	    goto unwind2;
846  | 
847  |     /**
848  |      **  Now tokenize the facilities string and schedule the error message
849  |      **  for every single facility
850  |      **/
851  |     for( fac = xstrtok( fac_buffer, ":");
852  | 	 fac;
853  | 	 fac = xstrtok( (char *) NULL, ":") ) {
854  | 
855  | 	/**
856  | 	 **  Check for filenames. Two specials are defined: stderr and stdout
857  | 	 **  Otherwise filenames are expected to begin on '.' or '/'.
858  | 	 **  Everthing not recognized as a filename is assumed to be a
859  | 	 **  syslog facility
860  | 	 **  'null' and 'none' are known as 'no logging'
861  | 	 **/
862  | 	if( !strcmp( fac, _null) || !strcmp( fac, _none))
863  | 	    continue;
864  | 
865  | 	else if( !strcmp( fac, _stderr))
866  | 	    fprintf( stderr, "%s", errmsg_buffer);
867  | 	
868  | 	else if( !strcmp( fac, _stdout)) 
869  | 	    fprintf( stdout, "%s", errmsg_buffer);
870  | 
871  | 	/**
872  | 	 **  Syslog
873  | 	 **/
874  | 	else if( '.' != *fac && '/' != *fac) {
875  | #if defined(HAVE_SYSLOG) && defined(WITH_LOGGING)
876  | 	    int syslog_fac, syslog_lvl;
877  | 
878  | 	/* now send to syslog */
879  | 	    if( CheckFacility( fac, &syslog_fac, &syslog_lvl)) {
880  | 		openlog( "modulecmd", LOG_PID, syslog_fac);
881  | 		setlogmask( LOG_UPTO( syslog_lvl));
882  | 		syslog( (syslog_fac | syslog_lvl), "%s", errmsg_buffer);
883  | 		closelog();
884  | 
885  | 	    /**
886  | 	     **  Invalid facilities ... take care not to end up in 
887  | 	     **  infinite loops
888  | 	     **/
889  | 	    } else if( Type == ERR_INVFAC ||
890  | 	               OK == ErrorLogger( ERR_INVFAC, LOC, fac, NULL)) 
891  | 		continue;
892  | #endif
893  | 	}
894  | 
895  | 	/**
896  | 	 **  Custom files ...
897  | 	 **  This may result from the syslog part above
898  | 	 **/
899  | 	if( '.' == *fac || '/' == *fac) {
900  | 	    if((FILE *) NULL == (facfp = fopen( fac, "a"))) {
901  | 
902  | 		if( WGHT_PANIC == Weight)	/** Avoid endless loops!     **/
903  | 		    goto unwind2;
904  | 
905  | 		/**
906  | 		 **  Invalid facilities ... take care not to end up in 
907  | 		 **  infinite loops
908  | 		 **/
909  | 		if( Type == ERR_INVFAC ||
910  | 		    OK == ErrorLogger( ERR_INVFAC, LOC, fac, NULL))
911  | 		    continue;
912  | 		else
913  | 		    goto unwind2;
914  | 	    }
915  | 
916  | 	    fprintf( facfp, "%s", errmsg_buffer);
917  | 
918  | 	    if( EOF == fclose( facfp))
919  | 		if( OK != ErrorLogger( ERR_CLOSE, LOC, fac, NULL))
920  | 		    goto unwind2;
921  | 
922  | 	}
923  |     } /** for **/
924  | 
925  |     /**
926  |      **  Return on success
927  |      **/
928  |     null_free((void *) &errmsg_buffer);
929  |     null_free((void *) &fac_buffer);
930  | success0:
931  |     return( 1);				/** -------- EXIT (SUCCESS) -------> **/
932  | 
933  | unwind2:
934  |     null_free((void *) &errmsg_buffer);
935  | unwind1:
936  |     null_free((void *) &fac_buffer);
937  | unwind0:
938  |     return( 0);				/** -------- EXIT (FAILURE) -------> **/
939  | 
940  | } /** End of 'FlushError' **/
941  | 
942  | /*++++
943  |  ** ** Function-Header ***************************************************** **
944  |  ** 									     **
945  |  **   Function:		GetFacility					     **
946  |  ** 									     **
947  |  **   Description:	Get the log facility according to the passed error   **
948  |  **			weight						     **
949  |  ** 									     **
950  |  **   First Edition:	1995/12/21					     **
951  |  ** 									     **
952  |  **   Parameters:	ErrWeights	  Weight	Error Weight	     **
953  |  ** 									     **
954  |  **   Result:		char*	NULL		No facility found	     **
955  |  **				Otherwise	Pointer to the colon separa- **
956  |  **						ted facility string	     **
957  |  ** 									     **
958  |  ** ************************************************************************ **
959  |  ++++*/
960  | 
961  | static	char	*GetFacility(	ErrWeights	  Weight)
962  | {
963  |     ErrFacilities	*facility;
964  | 
965  |     /**
966  |      **  Get the facility table entry at first
967  |      **/
968  |     if( !(facility = GetFacility_sub( Weight)))
969  | 	return((char *) NULL);
970  | 
971  |     /**
972  |      **  Now we've got two possibilities:
973  |      **      First of all there may be a custom facilitiy defined
974  |      **	     Otherwise the default facility is to be returned now
975  |      **/
976  |     return( facility->facility ? facility->facility : facility->def_facility);
977  | 
978  | } /** End of 'GetFacility' **/
979  | 
980  | static	ErrFacilities	*GetFacility_sub(	ErrWeights	  Weight)
981  | {
982  |     ErrFacilities	*low, *mid, *high, *save;
983  |     char		buffer[ 20];
984  | 
985  |     /**
986  |      **  Binary search for the passed facility in the Facilities table.
987  |      **  This requires the table to be sorted on ascending error weight
988  |      **/
989  |     low = Facilities;
990  |     high = Facilities + (sizeof( Facilities) / sizeof( Facilities[0]));
991  |     save = (ErrFacilities *) NULL;
992  |     mid = (ErrFacilities *) NULL;
993  | 
994  |     while( low < high) {
995  | 	save = mid;
996  | 	mid = low + ((high - low) / 2);
997  | 	if( save == mid)
998  | 	    low = mid = high;			/** Just to be sure ...	     **/
999  | 
1000 | 	if( mid->Weight > Weight) 
1001 | 	    high = mid;
1002 | 	else if( mid->Weight < Weight)
1003 | 	    low = mid;
1004 | 	else
1005 | 	    break;	/** found! **/
1006 |     }
1007 | 
1008 |     /**
1009 |      **  We have to check, if we've found something or if there's an internal
1010 |      **  error (wrong weight)
1011 |      **/
1012 |     if( mid->Weight != Weight) {
1013 | 	if( OK == ErrorLogger( ERR_INVWGHT, LOC, (sprintf( buffer, "%d",
1014 | 	    Weight), buffer), NULL))
1015 | 	    return( NULL);
1016 |     }
1017 | 
1018 |     return( mid);
1019 | 
1020 | } /** End of 'GetFacility_sub' **/
1021 | 
1022 | /*++++
1023 |  ** ** Function-Header ***************************************************** **
1024 |  ** 									     **
1025 |  **   Function:		CheckFacility					     **
1026 |  ** 									     **
1027 |  **   Description:	Check the passed string to be a valid combination    **
1028 |  **			of       <syslog_facility>.<syslog_level>	     **
1029 |  ** 									     **
1030 |  **   First Edition:	1995/12/21					     **
1031 |  ** 									     **
1032 |  **   Parameters:	char	*string		Input facility string	     **
1033 |  **			int	*facility	Buffer for the real facility **
1034 |  **			int	*level		Buffer for the real level    **
1035 |  ** 									     **
1036 |  **   Result:		int	1		Success			     **
1037 |  **				0		Failure. String not valid    **
1038 |  ** 									     **
1039 |  ** ************************************************************************ **
1040 |  ++++*/
1041 | 
1042 | int	CheckFacility(	char *string, int *facility, int *level)
1043 | {
1044 |     char *s, *buf;
1045 |     int x;
1046 | 
1047 |     /**
1048 |      **  We do not want to change the strings ... so allocate a buffer here
1049 |      **/
1050 |     if((char *) NULL == (buf = stringer(NULL,0, string,NULL)))
1051 | 	if( OK == ErrorLogger( ERR_STRING, LOC, NULL))
1052 | 	    goto unwind0;
1053 | 
1054 |     /** 
1055 |      **  We cannot use strtok here, because there's one initialized in an
1056 |      **  outer loop!
1057 |      **/
1058 |     for( s=buf; s && *s && *s != '.'; s++);
1059 |     if( !s || !*s)
1060 | 	goto unwind1;
1061 |     *s = '\0';
1062 | 	
1063 |     /**
1064 |      **  This should be the facility
1065 |      **/
1066 |     if( -1 == (x = scan_facility( buf, facility_names,
1067 | 	    (sizeof( facility_names) / sizeof( facility_names[0])) )))
1068 | 	goto unwind1;
1069 |     *facility = x;
1070 | 
1071 |     /**
1072 |      **  This should be the level
1073 |      **/
1074 |     if( -1 == (x = scan_facility( ++s, level_names, 
1075 | 	    (sizeof( level_names) / sizeof( level_names[0])) )))
1076 | 	goto unwind1;
1077 |     *level = x;
1078 | 
1079 |     /**
1080 |      **  Success
1081 |      **/
1082 |     null_free((void *) &buf);
1083 |     return( 1);				/** -------- EXIT (SUCCESS) -------> **/
1084 | 
1085 | unwind1:
1086 |     null_free((void *) &buf);
1087 | unwind0:
1088 |     return( 0);				/** -------- EXIT (FAILURE) -------> **/
1089 | 
1090 | } /** End of 'CheckFacility' **/
1091 | 
1092 | /*++++
1093 |  ** ** Function-Header ***************************************************** **
1094 |  ** 									     **
1095 |  **   Function:		scan_facility					     **
1096 |  ** 									     **
1097 |  **   Description:	Scan the passed facility names table for the given   **
1098 |  **			string and pass back the assigned token		     **
1099 |  ** 									     **
1100 |  **   First Edition:	1995/12/21					     **
1101 |  ** 									     **
1102 |  **   Parameters:	char		*s	String to be checked	     **
1103 |  **			FacilityNames	*table	Table of valid names and     **
1104 |  **						tokens			     **
1105 |  **			int		 size	Size of the table	     **
1106 |  ** 									     **
1107 |  **   Result:		int	-1		name not found in the table  **
1108 |  **				Otherwise	Assigned token		     **
1109 |  ** 									     **
1110 |  ** ************************************************************************ **
1111 |  ++++*/
1112 | 
1113 | static	int	scan_facility( char *s, FacilityNames *table, int size)
1114 | {
1115 |     FacilityNames *low, *mid, *high, *save;
1116 | 
1117 |     low = table;
1118 |     high = table + size;
1119 |     save = (FacilityNames *) NULL;
1120 | 
1121 |     while( low < high) {
1122 | 	int x;			/** Have to use this, because strcmp will    **/
1123 | 				/** not return -1 and 1 on Solaris 2.x	     **/
1124 | 	save = mid;
1125 | 	mid = low + ((high - low) / 2);
1126 | 	if( save == mid)
1127 | 	    low = mid = high;			/** To prevent endless loops **/
1128 | 
1129 | 	if (mid == high)
1130 | 		return -1;
1131 | 	x = strcmp( mid->name, s);
1132 | 
1133 | 	if( x < 0 )
1134 | 	    low = mid;
1135 | 	else if( x > 0)
1136 | 	    high = mid;
1137 | 	else
1138 | 	    return( mid->token);
1139 | 
1140 |     } /** while **/
1141 | 
1142 |     return( !strcmp( mid->name, s) ? mid->token : -1 );
1143 | 
1144 | } /** End of 'scan_facility' **/
1145 | 
1146 | /*++++
1147 |  ** ** Function-Header ***************************************************** **
1148 |  ** 									     **
1149 |  **   Function:		GetFacilityPtr					     **
1150 |  ** 									     **
1151 |  **   Description:	Scan the passed facility names table for the given   **
1152 |  **			string and pass back the assigned token		     **
1153 |  ** 									     **
1154 |  **   First Edition:	1995/12/21					     **
1155 |  ** 									     **
1156 |  **   Parameters:	char	*facility	Name of the facility	     **
1157 |  ** 									     **
1158 |  **   Result:		char**	NULL		Invalid facility name	     **
1159 |  **				Otherwise	Pointer to the facilty string**
1160 |  **						reference		     **
1161 |  ** 									     **
1162 |  ** ************************************************************************ **
1163 |  ++++*/
1164 | 
1165 | char	**GetFacilityPtr( char *facility)
1166 | {
1167 |     int		 	 i, len;
1168 |     ErrMeasr		*measptr;
1169 |     char		*buf, *t;
1170 |     ErrFacilities	*facptr;
1171 | 
1172 |     /**
1173 |      **  Try to figure out the error weight at first
1174 |      **  Need the given weight in upper case for this
1175 |      **/
1176 |     len = strlen( facility);
1177 | 
1178 |     if((char *) NULL == (buf = stringer(NULL, 0, facility, NULL)))
1179 | 	if( OK != ErrorLogger( ERR_ALLOC, LOC, NULL))
1180 | 	    goto unwind0;
1181 | 
1182 |     for( t = buf; *t; ++t) *t = toupper(*t);
1183 |     
1184 |     /**
1185 |      **  Now look up the measurements table for the uppercase weight
1186 |      **/
1187 |     i = sizeof( Measurements) / sizeof( Measurements[ 0]);
1188 |     measptr = Measurements;
1189 | 
1190 |     while( i) {
1191 | 	if( !strncmp( measptr->message, buf, len))
1192 | 	    break;
1193 | 	i--; measptr++;
1194 |     }
1195 | 
1196 |     null_free((void *) &buf);
1197 | 
1198 |     if( !i) 					/** not found		     **/
1199 | 	goto unwind0;
1200 |     
1201 |     /**
1202 |      **  Now get the facility table entry
1203 |      **/
1204 | 
1205 |     if((ErrFacilities *) NULL == (facptr = GetFacility_sub(
1206 | 	measptr->error_weight))) {
1207 | 	ErrorLogger( ERR_INVWGHT_WARN, LOC, facility, NULL); 
1208 | 	goto unwind0;
1209 |     }
1210 | 
1211 |     /**
1212 |      **  Got it ... return the desired pointer
1213 |      **/
1214 |     return( &facptr->facility);		/** -------- EXIT (RESULT)  -------> **/
1215 | 
1216 | unwind0:
1217 |     return((char **) NULL);		/** -------- EXIT (FAILURE) -------> **/
1218 | 
1219 | } /** End of 'GetFacilityPtr' **/
1220 | 
1221 | /*++++
1222 |  ** ** Function-Header ***************************************************** **
1223 |  ** 									     **
1224 |  **   Function:		PrintError					     **
1225 |  ** 									     **
1226 |  **   Description:	Print the error message				     **
1227 |  ** 									     **
1228 |  **   First Edition:	1995/08/06					     **
1229 |  ** 									     **
1230 |  **   Parameters:	char             *errbuffer	Buffer to hold the   **
1231 |  **							error messge	     **
1232 |  **			ErrType		  Type		Error type as passed **
1233 |  **			char		 *module	Module name	     **
1234 |  **			int		  lineno	Line number	     **
1235 |  **		  	ErrWeights	  Weight	Error Weight	     **
1236 |  **			char		 *WeightMsg	Printable Weight     **
1237 |  **			char		 *ErrMsgs	Error message	     **
1238 |  **			int		  argc		Number of arguments  **
1239 |  **			char		**argv		Argument array	     **
1240 |  ** 									     **
1241 |  **   Result:		int	1		Everything OK		     **
1242 |  **				0		Error occured while printing **
1243 |  ** 									     **
1244 |  **   Notes:	According to the error type, the passed module and line num- **
1245 |  **		ber will be handled as a module-file related one or depending**
1246 |  **		on the packages source code:				     **
1247 |  **									     **
1248 |  **		src -> ERR_IN_MODULEFILE -> modulefile -> ERR_INTERNAL -> src**
1249 |  ** 									     **
1250 |  ** ************************************************************************ **
1251 |  ++++*/
1252 | 
1253 | static	int	PrintError(	char 		 *errbuffer,
1254 | 				ErrType		  Type,
1255 | 				char		 *module,
1256 | 				int		  lineno,
1257 | 				ErrWeights	  Weight,
1258 | 				char		 *WeightMsg,
1259 | 				char		 *ErrMsgs,
1260 | 				int		  argc,
1261 | 				char		**argv)
1262 | {
1263 |     char	*error_string;
1264 | 
1265 |     /**
1266 |      **  Build the error string at first. Note - we cannot alloc memory any
1267 |      **  more!
1268 |      **/
1269 |     if( ERR_ALLOC == Type) 
1270 | 	error_string = ErrMsgs;
1271 |     else
1272 | 	if( NULL == (error_string = ErrorString( ErrMsgs, argc, argv)))
1273 | 	    return( 0);
1274 | 
1275 |     /**
1276 |      **  Print
1277 |      **/
1278 | 
1279 |     if( ERR_INTERNAL > Type && ERR_IN_MODULEFILE < Type &&
1280 | 	linenum && g_current_module )
1281 | 
1282 | 	sprintf( errbuffer, "%s(%s):%s:%d: %s\n", g_current_module,
1283 | 	    (sprintf( buffer, "%d", linenum), buffer),
1284 | 	    WeightMsg, Type, (error_string ? error_string : "") );
1285 |     else
1286 | 
1287 | 	sprintf( errbuffer, "%s(%s):%s:%d: %s\n", (module ? module : "??"),
1288 | 	    ( lineno ? (sprintf( buffer, "%d", lineno), buffer) : "??" ),
1289 | 	    WeightMsg, Type, (error_string ? error_string : "") );
1290 | 
1291 |     /**
1292 |      **  Success
1293 |      **/
1294 |     return( 1);
1295 | 
1296 | } /** End of 'PrintError' **/
1297 | 
1298 | /*++++
1299 |  ** ** Function-Header ***************************************************** **
1300 |  ** 									     **
1301 |  **   Function:		ErrorString					     **
1302 |  ** 									     **
1303 |  **   Description:	Format the error message			     **
1304 |  ** 									     **
1305 |  **   First Edition:	1995/08/06					     **
1306 |  ** 									     **
1307 |  **   Parameters:	char		 *ErrMsgs	Error message	     **
1308 |  **			int		  argc		Number of arguments  **
1309 |  **			char		**argv		Argument array	     **
1310 |  ** 									     **
1311 |  **   Result:		char*	NULL		Parse or alloc error	     **
1312 |  **				else		Pointer to the error string  **
1313 |  ** 									     **
1314 |  **   Attached Globals:	-						     **
1315 |  **									     **
1316 |  ** ************************************************************************ **
1317 |  ++++*/
1318 | 
1319 | static	char	*ErrorString(	char		 *ErrMsgs,
1320 | 				int		  argc,
1321 | 				char		**argv)
1322 | {
1323 |     char	*s;			/** Insertion pointer		     **/
1324 |     char	*X,*XErrMsgs;		/** gettext string pointer	     **/
1325 |     int		len = 0;		/** Current length		     **/
1326 |     int		backslash = 0;		/** backslash found ?		     **/
1327 | 
1328 |     if( !ErrMsgs)
1329 | 	return( NULL);
1330 | 
1331 |     /**
1332 |      **  Allocate memory if neccessary
1333 |      **/
1334 |     if( !error_line)
1335 | 	if((char *) NULL ==(error_line = stringer(NULL,strsize = ERR_LINELEN,
1336 | 		NULL))){
1337 | 	    ErrorLogger( ERR_STRING, LOC, NULL);
1338 | 	    return( NULL);
1339 | 	}
1340 | 
1341 |     s = error_line;
1342 |     X = XErrMsgs = _(ErrMsgs);
1343 | 
1344 |     /**
1345 |      **  Scan the error strings to be printed
1346 |      **/
1347 |     while( *X ) {
1348 | 
1349 | 	/**
1350 | 	 **  Check for special characters
1351 | 	 **/
1352 | 	switch( *X) {
1353 | 	    case '\\':	if( !backslash) {
1354 | 				backslash = 1;
1355 | 				X++;
1356 | 				continue;	/** while( *ErrMsgs) **/
1357 | 			    }
1358 | 			    break;	/** switch **/
1359 | 
1360 | 	    case '$':	if( !backslash) {
1361 | 				X++;
1362 | 				add_param( &X, &s, &len, argc, argv);
1363 | 				error_line = s - len;
1364 | 				continue;	/** while( *ErrMsgs) **/
1365 | 			    }
1366 | 			    break;	/** switch **/
1367 | 	} /** switch **/
1368 | 
1369 | 	/**
1370 | 	 **  Add a single character to the error string
1371 | 	 **/
1372 | 	if( ++len >= strsize - 5) {	/** 5 Bytes for safety		     **/
1373 | 	    if( NULL == (error_line = (char *) realloc( error_line,
1374 | 		strsize += ERR_LINELEN))) {
1375 | 		ErrorLogger( ERR_ALLOC, LOC, NULL);
1376 | 		return( NULL);
1377 | 	    }
1378 | 	    s = error_line + len - 1;
1379 | 	}
1380 | 
1381 | 	*s++ = *X++;
1382 | 	backslash = 0;
1383 | 				
1384 |     } /** while( *ErrMsgs) **/
1385 | 
1386 |     /**
1387 |      **  Success. Return a pointer to the newly created string
1388 |      **/
1389 |     *s++ = '\0';
1390 |     return( error_line);
1391 | 
1392 | } /** End of 'ErrorString' **/
1393 | 
1394 | /*++++
1395 |  ** ** Function-Header ***************************************************** **
1396 |  ** 									     **
1397 |  **   Function:		add_param					     **
1398 |  ** 									     **
1399 |  **   Description:	Put an argument to the error string		     **
1400 |  ** 									     **
1401 |  **   First Edition:	1995/08/06					     **
1402 |  ** 									     **
1403 |  **   Parameters:	char		**Control	Parameter control    **
1404 |  **			char		**Target	Target to print to   **
1405 |  **			int		 *Length	Current length of the**
1406 |  **							output string	     **
1407 |  **			int		  argc		Number of arguments  **
1408 |  **			char		**argv		Argument array	     **
1409 |  ** 									     **
1410 |  **   Result:		-						     **
1411 |  ** 									     **
1412 |  **   Attached Globals:	-						     **
1413 |  **									     **
1414 |  ** ************************************************************************ **
1415 |  ++++*/
1416 | 
1417 | static	void	add_param(	char		**Control,
1418 | 				char		**Target,
1419 | 				int		 *Length,
1420 | 				int		  argc,
1421 | 				char		**argv)
1422 | {
1423 |     char	*s;			/** Scan pointer for the ctrl field  **/
1424 |     int		index, last = 0;	/** parameter index		     **/
1425 |     int		len = 0;		/** Parameter string length	     **/
1426 | 
1427 |     /**
1428 |      **  Copy the current control field into the buffer
1429 |      **/
1430 | 
1431 |     for( s = buffer; **Control; (*Control)++ ) {
1432 | 
1433 | 	if( **Control == '*') {
1434 | 	    last = argc;
1435 | 	    continue;
1436 | 	} else if( **Control < '0' || **Control > '9')
1437 | 	    break;
1438 | 
1439 | 	*s++ = **Control;
1440 |     }
1441 | 
1442 |     *s = '\0';
1443 | 
1444 |     /**
1445 |      **  Has something been found ? If not, print a '$'
1446 |      **/
1447 |     if( s == buffer && !last) {
1448 | 
1449 | 	if( ++(*Length) >= strsize) {
1450 | 	    if( NULL == (error_line = (char*) realloc( error_line,
1451 | 		strsize += ERR_LINELEN))) {
1452 | 		ErrorLogger( ERR_ALLOC, LOC, NULL);
1453 | 		return;
1454 | 	    }
1455 | 	    *Target = error_line + *Length - 1;
1456 | 	}
1457 | 
1458 | 	*(*Target++) = '$';
1459 | 
1460 |     } else {
1461 | 
1462 | 	/**
1463 | 	 **  Something has been found. Form the parameter index at first
1464 | 	 **/
1465 | 	if( s == buffer)
1466 | 	    index = 0;
1467 | 	else
1468 | 	    index = atoi( buffer) - 1;
1469 | 
1470 | 	if( !last)
1471 | 	    last = index + 1;
1472 | 	if( last > argc)
1473 | 	    last = argc;
1474 | 
1475 | 	/**
1476 | 	 **  Spool them all out
1477 | 	 **/
1478 | 	while( index < last) {
1479 | 
1480 | 	    len = strlen( argv[ index]);
1481 | 
1482 | 	    while(( *Length + len + 1) >= strsize - 5) {
1483 | 		if( NULL == (error_line = (char*) realloc( error_line,
1484 | 		    strsize += ERR_LINELEN))) {
1485 | 		    ErrorLogger( ERR_ALLOC, LOC, NULL);
1486 | 		    return;
1487 | 		}
1488 | 		*Target = error_line + *Length;
1489 | 	    }
1490 | 
1491 | 	    strcpy( *Target, argv[ index]);
1492 | 	    *Target += len;
1493 | 	    *Length += len;
1494 | 
1495 | 	    index++;
1496 | 
1497 | 	} /** while **/
1498 |     } /** if **/
1499 | 
1500 | } /** End of 'add_param' **/
